arch:property.oc:show_val: Locus 43 and Locus 35 the Pavement Floor to the south.

Phase VIII: Brief (?) period of abandonment. Collapse of the arches spanning the East 'Cistern.' Possible placement of an infant jar burial in Room B. Early robbing of floor pavements in the East Plaza, South Passageway and parts of the Shrine Room, Baroque Room and Anteroom.
Locus 30 Large Limestone Basin and Locus 26 Fill.

This is the sandstone platform on which rests the limestone basin. It is composed of small ashlars that are laid to provide a level support for the basin. The integrity of this single course platform has been compromised in the front, but its rear is intact and shows that it was laid with a wet mortar. The platform, like the basin has been assigned to this stage because of its location above the west Cistern-Reservoir walls and its association with these walls.
Locus 43 the West Cistern-Reservoir upper course.
Platform for the Large Limestone Basin
Closing elevation: 902.094 m in the southeast corner of bedrock to the west of the Cistern-Reservoir West Wall.
Repair to west and north walls.
Opening elevation: 902.294 m, 0.13 m above the bedrock, -1.86 m below Sub Datum P.
